revised_title: The Role of Tropomyosin and Troponin in the Cross-Striation of Vertebrate Skeletal Muscle Thin Filaments
tldr: The author's study on actin paracrystals provides evidence that the cross-striation in the thin filaments of vertebrate skeletal muscle is due to the location of the troponin complex at regular intervals along the filaments. The addition of tropomyosin and troponin to purified actin creates paracrystals that reproduce the cross-striation, suggesting that these proteins play a role in the structure of the thin filaments.
